content.text: I'll help you add a Playwright MCP server to your project. Let me start by examining the current project structure to understand how to integrate this properly.

todos.content: Examine current project structure and MCP setup
Research Playwright MCP server requirements
Install necessary dependencies
Configure Playwright MCP server
Test the MCP server integration

  "name": "@niceltd/sol",
  "version": "12.0.0",
  "scripts": {
    "ng": "ng",
    "start": "ng serve ds-showcase --port 4200",
    "build-storybook": "ng run ds-components:build-storybook",
    "build-storybook-prod": "npm run docs:json && ng run ds-components:build-storybook --config-dir ./projects/storybook/.storybook --output-dir ./dist/storybook ",
    "build:lib": "node --version && npm run fetch-tokens && ng build ds-components && npm run copy-sol-tokens && npm run build-storybook-prod",
    "build:lib:debug": "npm run fetch-tokens && ng build ds-components && npm run copy-sol-tokens",
    "fetch-tokens": "cpy node_modules/@niceltd/sol-tokens/sol-tokens.css ./projects/storybook/.storybook/assets",
    "copy-sol-tokens": "node ./scripts/sol-cpy-tokens.js",
    "postbuild:lib": "npm run build-playwright-pageobjects",
    "postbuild:lib:debug": "npm run build-playwright-pageobjects",
    "build-playwright-pageobjects": "node node_modules/@niceltd/cxone-playwright-test-utils/corral-playwright-pageobjects.js projects/ds-components tmp && node ./scripts/update-page-object-imports-v2.js && node node_modules/typescript/bin/tsc --project tsconfig.playwright.json",
    "test:lib:single": "ng test ds-components --code-coverage --watch=false --karma-config ./projects/ds-components/karma.conf.js && npm run test:schematics",
    "test:lib": "ng test ds-components --code-coverage --watch=true",
    "test:ghworkflow": "ng build ds-components && npm run test:lib:single",
    "docs:json": "compodoc -p ./tsconfig.json -e json -d ./projects/storybook",
    "storybook": "ng run ds-components:storybook",
    "storybook:buildlib": "npm run build:lib:debug && npm run docs:json && npm run storybook",
    "format": "npx prettier ./projects/**/*.{js,ts,html,css,scss} ./e2e/**/*.{js,ts,html,css,scss} --write",
    "format-check": "npx prettier ./projects/**/*.{js,ts,html,css,scss} --check",
    "build:change-log": "(cat changelog-template-start.html && node_modules/.bin/marked CHANGELOG.md && cat changelog-template-end.html) > ",
    "e2e-suite_01": "npx playwright install chromium && npx playwright test --config=e2e/suite01/suite01.config.ts",

    "lint": "",

    "lint:styles": "npx stylelint \"projects/**/*.{css,scss,sass}\"",
    "test:schematics": "npm run schematics:build && jasmine --config=jasmine-schematics.json",
    "schematics:build": "npx rimraf dist/sol/schematics && npx tsc -p tsconfig.schematics.json",
    "build:schematics": "npm run schematics:build",
    "postschematics:build": "npm run schematics:copy:schemas && npm run schematics:copy:files && npm run schematics:copy:collection",
    "schematics:copy:schemas": "(cd projects && npx copyfiles schematics/**/schema.json ../dist/sol/)",
    "schematics:copy:files": "(cd projects && npx copyfiles -R schematics/*/files/** ../dist/sol/)",
    "schematics:copy:collection": "npx copyfiles -f projects/schematics/collection.json dist/sol/schematics"

    "@niceltd/sol-tokens": "1.8.0",
    "@playwright/test": "1.50.1",
    "@storybook/addon-actions": "^8.0.6",
    "@storybook/addon-docs": "^8.0.6",

    "@storybook/addon-links": "^8.0.6",
    "@storybook/addon-mdx-gfm": "^8.0.6",
    "@storybook/angular": "^8.0.6",
    "@storybook/blocks": "^8.0.6",
    "@storybook/manager-api": "^8.0.9",
    "@storybook/test": "^8.0.6",
    "@storybook/theming": "^8.0.6",
    "@types/jasmine": "~5.1.0",
    "@types/jsdom": "^21.1.7",
    "@types/node": "^20.9.0",
    "@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin": "^6.15.0",
    "@typescript-eslint/parser": "^6.15.0",
    "babel-loader": "^8.2.5",
    "copyfiles": "^2.4.1",
    "cpy": "7.3.0",

    "jasmine": "^5.4.0",

    "karma": "~6.4.0",
    "karma-chrome-launcher": "~3.2.0",
    "karma-coverage": "~2.2.0",
    "karma-jasmine": "~5.1.0",
    "karma-jasmine-html-reporter": "~2.1.0",
    "karma-junit-reporter": "2.0.1",
    "karma-sonarqube-unit-reporter": "0.0.23",
    "marked": "^4.0.16",
    "moment": "^2.29.4",

    "stylelint-config-prettier": "^9.0.3",
    "stylelint-config-prettier-scss": "^0.0.1",
    "stylelint-config-standard": "^25.0.0",
    "stylelint-config-standard-scss": "^4.0.0",
    "ts-loader": "^9.5.1",
    "ts-log": "^2.2.4",
    "typescript": "5.2.2",
    "util": "^0.12.5",
    "webpack": "^5.74.0"
  },
  "cxonePeerDependencyOverrides": {
    "ag-grid-angular": {
      "find": "~31.0.0",
      "replace": "^31.0.0"
    },

      "find": "~31.0.0",

    },

Links: [{"title":"Using Playwright MCP with Claude Code | Simon Willison’s TILs","url":"https://til.simonwillison.net/claude-code/playwright-mcp-claude-code"},{"title":"Microsoft Playwright MCP - Claude MCP Servers","url":"https://www.claudemcp.com/servers/playwright"},{"title":"TIL: Using Playwright MCP with Claude Code","url":"https://simonwillison.net/2025/Jul/1/using-playwright-mcp-with-claude-code/"},{"title":"Official Playwright MCP Server + Claude AI: Integration Guide | by Testers Talk | Jun, 2025 | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/@testerstalk/official-playwright-mcp-server-claude-ai-integration-guide-dcad70df3969"},{"title":"claude-code-playwright-mcp | MCP Servers · LobeHub","url":"https://lobehub.com/mcp/sia819-claude-code-playwright-mcp"},{"title":"How to Install MCP Servers in Claude Code","url":"https://www.stefanwille.com/2025/07/2025-07-13-how-to-install-an-mcp-server-in-claude-code"},{"title":"API Testing with LLM(Claude) and Playwright MCP (Model Context Protocol) | by KailashPathak | Jun, 2025 | Medium","url":"https://kailash-pathak.medium.com/api-testing-with-llm-claude-and-playwright-mcp-model-context-protocol-a08d6ab979dd"},{"title":"GitHub - executeautomation/mcp-playwright: Playwright Model Context Protocol Server - Tool to automate Browsers and APIs in Claude Desktop, Cline, Cursor IDE and More 🔌","url":"https://github.com/executeautomation/mcp-playwright"},{"title":"GitHub - microsoft/playwright-mcp: Playwright MCP server","url":"https://github.com/microsoft/playwright-mcp"},{"title":"Playwright MCP Server | Playwright MCP Server","url":"https://executeautomation.github.io/mcp-playwright/docs/intro"}]

Based on the web search results, here's what I found about Playwright MCP server integration with Claude Code in 2025:

## Playwright MCP Server with Claude Code Integration

The integration of Playwright MCP server with Claude Code has gained significant attention in 2025, with multiple tutorials and guides available. Here are the key findings:

### Installation Methods

There are several ways to install and set up Playwright MCP with Claude Code:

1. **Using claude mcp add command:**
   To install the Playwright MCP server, you can run: `claude mcp add playwright -s user -- npx -y @executeautomation/playwright-mcp-server`

2. **Microsoft's Official Playwright MCP:**
   Microsoft provides an official Playwright MCP server that enables LLMs to interact with web pages through structured accessibility snapshots, bypassing the need for screenshots or visually-tuned models

3. **Alternative Installation via Smithery:**
   You can also install using Smithery: `npx @smithery/cli install @executeautomation/playwright-mcp-server --client claude`

### Key Features and Capabilities

Once installed, you can instruct Claude to "Use playwright mcp to open a browser to example.com" and a visible Chrome browser window, controlled by Claude Code, will open. Authentication is easy since the browser window is visible, allowing users to login manually.

The integration allows Claude to navigate pages, submit forms, execute custom JavaScript and take screenshots to feed back into the LLM. The browser window stays visible, enabling user interaction including signing into websites.

### Configuration Options

The `claude mcp add` command persists but only affects the directory in which you run it, with settings stored in a JSON file ~/.claude.json which includes a "projects" key with objects for each directory used with Claude Code.

### Recent Developments

Based on the web search results, here's what I found about Playwright MCP server integration with Claude Code in 2025:

## Playwright MCP Server with Claude Code Integration

The integration of Playwright MCP server with Claude Code has gained significant attention in 2025, with multiple tutorials and guides available. Here are the key findings:

### Installation Methods

There are several ways to install and set up Playwright MCP with Claude Code:

1. **Using claude mcp add command:**
   To install the Playwright MCP server, you can run: `claude mcp add playwright -s user -- npx -y @executeautomation/playwright-mcp-server`

2. **Microsoft's Official Playwright MCP:**
   Microsoft provides an official Playwright MCP server that enables LLMs to interact with web pages through structured accessibility snapshots, bypassing the need for screenshots or visually-tuned models

3. **Alternative Installation via Smithery:**
   You can also install using Smithery: `npx @smithery/cli install @executeautomation/playwright-mcp-server --client claude`

### Key Features and Capabilities

Once installed, you can instruct Claude to "Use playwright mcp to open a browser to example.com" and a visible Chrome browser window, controlled by Claude Code, will open. Authentication is easy since the browser window is visible, allowing users to login manually.

The integration allows Claude to navigate pages, submit forms, execute custom JavaScript and take screenshots to feed back into the LLM. The browser window stays visible, enabling user interaction including signing into websites.

### Configuration Options

The `claude mcp add` command persists but only affects the directory in which you run it, with settings stored in a JSON file ~/.claude.json which includes a "projects" key with objects for each directory used with Claude Code.

input.prompt: Extract the exact steps needed to install and configure Playwright MCP server with Claude Code

content.content:
Here are the exact steps to install and configure Playwright MCP server with Claude Code:

1. Run the following command in your project directory:
   `claude mcp add playwright npx '@playwright/mcp@latest'`

2. When using Playwright, explicitly say "playwright mcp" the first time to ensure proper initialization.

3. Authentication is straightforward - Claude will open a visible browser window, and you can log in manually.

4. The configuration is directory-specific and stored in `~/.claude.json` under the "projects" key.

Key notes:
- The MCP will persist only in the current directory
- You can view available Playwright tools by running `/mcp` and navigating to `playwright`
- Claude should automatically select the appropriate Playwright tool for your task
